DOC.brief_summary: Official title : LAPAD - A prospective study effect adhesiolysis elective laparotomy laparoscopy per- postoperative complication , quality life socioeconomic cost Background : With improved surgical technology age population number reoperations abdomen dramatically increase . The risk repeat laparotomy laparoscopy high 30 % first ten year laparotomy . In 95 % reoperations adhesiolysis require gain access abdominal cavity operation area . Adhesiolysis significantly increase risk inadvertent organ damage , enterotomy , lead high morbidity , mortality socioeconomic cost . Purpose : To define impact adhesiolysis per- postoperative complication , quality life socioeconomic cost . Design : Prospective observational study . Primary outcome : - adhesiolysis time - inadvertent enterotomy - seromuscular injury - miscellaneous organ damage - Serious adverse event operation ( anastomotic leakage , delay diagnose perforation , wound infection , abdominal infection , haemorrhage , pneumonia , urinary tract infection , abscess , fistula , sepsis , death ) Secondary outcome : - Hospital stay - Intensive care admission - Reinterventions - In-hospital cost - Parenteral feed - Short term readmission ( 30 day ) - Quality life ( Gastro- intestinal tract complaint , Short Form- 36 ( SF-36 ) , DASI ( Duke Activity Score Index ( DASI ) ) Estimated enrollment : 800 start study : 1 june 2008 Inclusion completion date : 1 june 2010 Estimated study completion date : 1 february 2011
